channel.title: Work on Punit's Blogs
channel.description: Recent content in Work on Punit's Blogs

item.title: Trip to Regional Schools
item.description:
This photo was taken during my recent trip to Bulahdelah Central School.

ANU Wonder Program

ANU Wonder is a program that works with people from underrepresented backgrounds to access education after school.

We work around the ACT and NSW with young people, in primary and high schools, and with mature age students too! ANU Wonder provides information, helps people consider interests and strengths, and supports the steps to make aspirations real. We visit schools and run activities there, and we welcome people onto the ANU campus too. Our team includes excellent ANU Student Leaders who share their own experiences.

item.title: Community Support Officer
item.description:
My Role

My role is part of one of the most unique models across Australia. It provides pastoral care and support. Each day could look very different to the day before. Being in the university setting, I am in charge of providing pastoral care and support to the residents of the ANU’s residential Halls. I am also the first point of contact for over 500 people living in the building throughout the year afterhours from 4pm to midnight. Some of the things that I have dealt with but not restricited to are:
